meanings.definition: A silent performance or gesture used to convey a message or story
meanings.sent1: The actors used a dumbshow to act out the scene without speaking.
meanings.sent2: The play included a beautiful dumbshow to illustrate the backstory.
meanings.sent3: The dumbshow of the animals pretending to talk made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were a dumbshow of sadness, telling a story without words.
meanings.sent5: The mime's dumbshow of climbing a ladder was so realistic, it amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A pantomime or mimed scene in a play
meanings.sent1: During the dumbshow, the actors acted out a silent conversation.
meanings.sent2: The dumbshow at the beginning of the play set the mood for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The dumbshow of the characters dancing silently was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His expression was a dumbshow of surprise, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The dumbshow of the storm approaching was so well done, it felt real.
